en: Many beta-testers are offering feedback on one specific feature of your product. The problem is, the feedback is conflicting!
Half seem to love it and half seem to hate it. How exactly should you handle this?
You choose to keep it. Sometimes, a polarizing feature is exactly what a product needs. Better to love it than to like it!
You decide to change it, hoping with a few tweaks the e-mails will be universally positive.
When you finish, you await the feedback - and it's the same as before.
It seems you can't please everyone. At least you know you tried!
